intro: Craspedia coolaminica, commonly known as the Coolamin daisy, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features showy yellow ray florets surrounding a central disc of tubular flowers, which attract pollinators such as bees and birds. It typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun. Craspedia coolaminica is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
